AccesstypeEnum.description: It provides the condition of access type of the UE when the session AMBR shall be enforced.

ActiveEnum.description: It indicates the active access, see TS 29.571.

AfsigprotocolEnum.description: Indicates the protocol used for signalling between the UE and the AF, the default value is NO_INFORMATION.

DnaichgtypeEnum.description: It indicates the type of DNAI change, see TS 29.512

FdirEnum.description: It indicates the packet filter direction.

FlowdirectionEnum.description: It indicates the direction/directions that a filter is applicable.

FlowstatusEnum.description: It represents whether the service data flow(s) are enabled or disabled.

MulaccctrlEnum.description: It indicates whether the service data flow, corresponding to the service data flow template, is allowed or not allowed.

PredefinedPccRules.description: The list of predefined PCC rules.

PreemptcapEnum.description: It defines whether a service data flow may get resources that were already assigned to another service data flow with a lower priority level.

PreemptvulnEnum.description: It defines whether a service data flow may lose the resources assigned to it in order to admit a service data flow with higher priority level.

PrioaccEnum.description: It indicates the high priority access.

RattypeEnum.description: It provides the condition of RAT type of the UE when the session AMBR shall be enforced.

RedirectaddresstypeEnum.description: It indicates the type of redirect address.

StandbyEnum.description: It indicates the Standby access, see TS 29.571.

SteerfunEnum.description: It indicates the applicable traffic steering functionality.

SteermodevalueEnum.description: It indicates the value of the steering mode, see TS 29.512.

accessType.description: It provides the condition of access type of the UE when the session AMBR shall be enforced.

activationTime.description: It indicates the time (in date_time format) when the decision data shall be activated.

active.description: It indicates the active access, see TS 29.571.

afAckInd.description: It identifies whether the AF acknowledgement of UP path event notification is expected.

afSigProtocol.description: Indicates the protocol used for signalling between the UE and the AF, the default value is NO_INFORMATION.

appDescriptor.description: It is the ATSSS rule application descriptor.

applicationId.description: A reference to the application detection filter configured at the UPF.

burstArrivalTime.description: It Indicates the arrival time (in date_time format) of the data burst in reference to the TSN GM.

condId.description: It uniquely identifies the condition data.

contentVersion.description: Indicates the content version of the PCC rule.

deactivationTime.description: It indicates the time (in date_time format) when the decision data shall be deactivated.

destMacAddr.description: It specifies the destination MAC address formatted in the hexadecimal .

destMacAddrEnd.description: It specifies the destination MAC address end. If this attribute is present, the destMacAddr attribute specifies the destination MAC address start.

dnai.description: It represents the DNAI (Data network access identifier).

dnaiChgType.description: It indicates the type of DNAI change, see TS 29.512

ethType.description: A two_octet string that represents the Ethertype.

extMaxDataBurstVol.description: It denotes the largest amount of data that is required to be transferred within a period of 5G_AN PDB, see TS 29.512

fDesc.description: It contains the flow description for the Uplink or Downlink IP flow. It shall be present when the ethtype is IP.

fDir.description: It indicates the packet filter direction.

flowDescription.description: It defines a packet filter for an IP flow.

flowDirection.description: It indicates the direction/directions that a filter is applicable.

flowLabel.description: It specifies the Ipv6 flow label header field.

flowStatus.description: It represents whether the service data flow(s) are enabled or disabled.

gbrDl.description: It represents the guaranteed downlink bandwidth.

gbrUl.description: It represents the guaranteed uplink bandwidth.

ipv4Addr.description: It defines the Ipv4 address of the tunnel end point in the data network, formatted in the dotted decimal notation.

ipv6Addr.description: It defines the Ipv6 address of the tunnel end point in the data network.

isAppRelocatable.description: It indicates the application relocation possibility, the default value is NO_INFORMATION.

isUeAddrPreserved.description: It Indicates whether UE IP address should be preserved.

maxPacketLossRateDl.description: It indicates the downlink maximum rate for lost packets that can be tolerated for the service data flow.

maxPacketLossRateUl.description: It indicates the uplink maximum rate for lost packets that can be tolerated for the service data flow.

maxbrDl.description: It represents the maximum downlink bandwidth.

maxbrUl.description: It represents the maximum uplink bandwidth.

mulAccCtrl.description: It indicates whether the service data flow, corresponding to the service data flow template, is allowed or not allowed.

muteNotif.description: It indicates whether applicat'on's start or stop notification is to be muted.

notifCorreId.description: It is used to set the value of Notification Correlation ID in the notification sent by the SMF, see TS 29.512

notificationUri.description: It provides notification address (Uri) of AF receiving the event notification.

packFiltId.description: It is the identifier of the packet filter.

packetFilterUsage.description: It indicates if the packet shall be sent to the UE.

periodicity.description: It identifies the time period between the start of two bursts in reference to the TSN GM.

portNumber.description: It defines the UDP port number of the tunnel end point in the data network, see TS 29.571

precedence.description: It indicates the order in which this PCC rule is applied relative to other PCC rules within the same PDU session.

preemptCap.description: It defines whether a service data flow may get resources that were already assigned to another service data flow with a lower priority level.

preemptVuln.description: It defines whether a service data flow may lose the resources assigned to it in order to admit a service data flow with higher priority level.

prioAcc.description: It indicates the high priority access.

priorityLevel.description: It defines the relative importance of a resource request.

qosId.description: It identifies the QoS control policy data for a PCC rule.

qosNotificationControl.description: It indicates whether notifications are requested from 3GPP NG_RAN when the GFBR can no longer (or again) be guaranteed for a QoS Flow during the lifetime of the QoS Flow.

ratType.description: It provides the condition of RAT type of the UE when the session AMBR shall be enforced.

redirectAddressType.description: It indicates the type of redirect address.

redirectEnabled.description: It indicates whether the redirect instruction is enabled.

redirectServerAddress.description: It indicates the address of the redirect server.

reflectiveQos.description: Indicates whether the QoS information is reflective for the corresponding non_GBR service data flow

sharingKeyDl.description: It indicates, by containing the same value, what PCC rules may share resource in downlink direction.

sharingKeyUl.description: It indicates, by containing the same value, what PCC rules may share resource in uplink direction.

sourceMacAddr.description: It specifies the source MAC address formatted in the hexadecimal notation.

spi.description: It is the security parameter index of the IPSec packet.

srcMacAddrEnd.description: It specifies the source MAC address end. If this attribute is present, the sourceMacAddr attribute specifies the source MAC address start. E.g. srcMacAddrEnd with value 00_10_A4_23_3E_FE and sourceMacAddr with value 00_10_A4_23_3E_02 means all MAC addresses from 00_10_A4_23_3E_02 up to and including 00_10_A4_23_3E_FE.

standby.description: It indicates the Standby access, see TS 29.571.

steerFun.description: It indicates the applicable traffic steering functionality.

steerModeValue.description: It indicates the value of the steering mode, see TS 29.512.

tcId.description: It univocally identifies the traffic control policy data within a PDU session.

threeGLoad.description: It indicates the traffic load to steer to the 3GPP Access expressed in one percent.

tosTrafficClass.description: It contains the Ipv4 Type_of_Service and mask field or the Ipv6 Traffic_Class field and mask field.

trafficSteeringPolIdDl.description: It references to a pre_configured traffic steering policy for downlink traffic at the SMF, see TS 29.512

trafficSteeringPolIdUl.description: It references to a pre_configured traffic steering policy for uplink traffic at the SMF, see TS 29.512
